contentList.content: You learn one Eldritch Invocation option of your choice from the warlock class.
Studying occult lore, you have unlocked eldritch power within yourself.

Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You gain Proficiency in one skill, and your Proficiency Bonus is doubled in another of your choice.

You learn Misty Step and a Level 1 spell from the Divination or Enchantment school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Intelligence score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Intelligence.

You learn Misty Step and a Level 1 spell from the Divination or Enchantment school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Wisdom score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Wisdom.

You learn Misty Step and a Level 1 spell from the Divination or Enchantment school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Charisma score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Charisma.
Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you.

You learn Invisibility and a Level 1 spell from the Illusion or Necromancy school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Intelligence score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Intelligence.

You learn Invisibility and a Level 1 spell from the Illusion or Necromancy school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Wisdom score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Wisdom.

You learn Invisibility and a Level 1 spell from the Illusion or Necromancy school of magic. You can cast both spells without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest, and your Charisma score increases by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your spellcasting ability for both spells is Charisma.
Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you.

Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can move it 1.5m to an unoccupied space. When you score a Critical Hit that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with Advantage until the start of your next turn.
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you push it back 1.5m.

When you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> until the start of your next turn.

Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals piercing damage, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result. When you score a Critical Hit that deals piercing damage to a creature, you roll one additional damage die when determining the extra piercing damage the target takes.
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals piercing damage, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.

When you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> that deals piercing damage to a creature, you roll one additional damage die when determining the extra piercing damage the target takes.

Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the speed of the target by 3m until the start of your next turn. When you score a Critical Hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has Disadvantage on all attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the speed of the target by 50% until the start of your next turn.

When you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on all attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
You learn one Fighting Style option of your choice from the fighter class.
Your martial training has helped you develop a particular style of fighting.

You learn two Metamagic options of your choice from the sorcerer class and gain 2 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> to fuel them. You regain expended Sorcery Points after a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

You learn the Mage Hand cantrip, can cast it without verbal or somatic components, and make it invisible. You also learn the Telekinetic: Push and Telekinetic: Pull actions.
You have learned to cast the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand">Mage Hand</LSTag> cantrip without verbal or somatic components, and the hand is invisible.
As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>, you can telekinetically shove a creature away from you.
As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>, you can telekinetically shove a creature towards you.

When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Lighting, or Poison damage, once per Short Rest you can use your reaction to give yourself Resistance to that damage type until the start of your next turn.

You also learn the Chromatic Infusion action, and can use it once per Long Rest.
Gift of the Chromatic Dragon: Chromatic Infusion
You touch a weapon and infuse it with Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals additional damage of the chosen type.
Gift of the Chromatic Dragon: Reactive Resistance

When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Lighting, or Poison damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to that damage until the start of your next turn. Once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.

Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

When you take damage from a creature within 3m of you, you can use your reaction to deal force damage and attempt to push the creature away.
Gift of the Gem Dragon: Telekinetic Reprisal
When you take damage from a creature within 3m of you, you can use your reaction to deal [1] force damage and attempt to push the creature away.

You learn the Cure Wounds spell, and can cast it without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest.

When you are hit by an Attack Roll, you can use your reaction to grant a bonus to your Armour Class equal to your Proficiency Bonus.
Gift of the Metallic Dragon: Draconic Healing
You've learned the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_CureWounds">Cure Wounds</LSTag> spell, and can cast it without expending a spell slot once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Gift of the Metallic Dragon: Protective Wings

When you are hit by an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, you can use your reaction to grant a bonus to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.

Your Intelligence or Wisdom increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Investigation and Perception Checks.

You're quick to notice the details of your environment. Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> is also doubled for Investigation and Perception <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>.
You gain the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_InspiringLeader">Inspiring Leader</LSTag> action.
You have learned to inspire your allies, shoring up their resolve to fight.
